detail.content: Academy of American Poets Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize, CWP | NYU                         NEW YORK UNIVERSITY       ARTS AND SCIENCE       COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE       GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                           Creative Writing Program                                                                                                Back to  previous page                Printer Friendly       Fourth Annual NYU Academy of American Poets Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize     We are excited to announce NYU’s fourth annual Academy of American Poets Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize. The recipient(s) of this prize will receive a cash award, a one-year membership to the Academy of American Poets, which includes a subscription to the Academy's journal American Poet , and recognition in the Academy’s newsletter. To enter, submit up to two poems by Monday, February 24, 2014 to      cwp.ug.awards@nyu.edu , with the subject line “Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize” (.doc files only). A faculty judge, to be announced, will complete a blind review of the submissions and select the prize recipient. All NYU undergraduate students are eligible to submit their poems to this prize competition.  Congratulations to the recipients of the fourth annual   Judith Lobel Arkin Academy of American Poets Prize! Following a blind   review of the submissions, faculty judges Matthew Rohrer and Elaine Equi selected the   following winner and runners-up: Winners     Susannah Maltz, for her poem " She would deny this now "    Honorable Mentions   Willis Plummer, for his poem " good and beautiful " Naomi Amado, for her poem " Two Hosts at an Upscale Restaurant " Thanks to all who submitted their poems for consideration!                Back to Top                                         Contact Us | © New York University , Arts and Science

Academy of American Poets Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize, CWP | NYU                         NEW YORK UNIVERSITY       ARTS AND SCIENCE       COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE       GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                           Creative Writing Program                                                                                                Back to  previous page                Printer Friendly       Third Annual NYU Academy of American Poets Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize     We are excited to announce NYU’s third annual Academy of American Poets Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize. The recipient(s) of this prize will receive a cash award, a one-year membership to the Academy of American Poets, and recognition in the Academy’s newsletter. To enter, submit up to two poems by Friday, February 22, 2013 to cwp.ug.awards@nyu.edu, with the subject line “Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize” (.doc files only). A faculty judge, to be announced, will complete a blind review of the submissions and select the prize recipient. All NYU undergraduate students are eligible to submit their poems to this prize competition.  Congratulations to the recipients of the second annual   Judith Lobel Arkin Academy of American Poets Prize! Following a blind   review of the submissions, faculty judge Geoffrey Nutter selected the   following winners and runner-up: Winners     Josh Gaither, for his poem " Debris: Past and Present " Stela Xhiku, for her poem " The Eye of an Eel as it Melts "    Honorable Mentions   Leora Rosenberg, for her poem " In the New Country " Thanks to all who submitted their poems for consideration!                Back to Top                                         Contact Us | © New York University , Arts and Science

Academy of American Poets Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize, CWP | NYU                         NEW YORK UNIVERSITY       ARTS AND SCIENCE       COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE       GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                           Creative Writing Program                                                                                                Back to  previous page                Printer Friendly       Fifth Annual NYU Academy of American Poets Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize     We are excited to announce NYU’s fifth annual Academy of American Poets Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize. The recipient(s) of this prize will receive a cash award, a one-year membership to the Academy of American Poets, which includes a subscription to the Academy's journal American Poet , and recognition in the Academy’s newsletter. Beginning in January 2015, you may email your   submission as a Microsoft Word attachment with subject line “Judith Lobel Arkin Poetry Prize” to cwp.ug.awards@nyu.edu .   Be sure to include your full name, age, University ID (N#), and NYU School   in your email (however, please do not include this information in the   submission itself). Applicants must be age 23 or under to be eligible for the prize. The submission deadline for this contest is March 2 . Students may submit up to two poems. A faculty judge will conduct a blind review of the submissions and select the prize recipient. All NYU undergraduate students are eligible to submit their poems to this prize competition.  Congratulations to the recipients of the fifth annual   Judith Lobel Arkin Academy of American Poets Prize! Following a blind   review of the submissions, faculty judge John Murillo selected the   following winner and runner-up:  Winner Mark Sologuren for his poem " time/Tuscany (Marko Paulo)"  Honorable Mention Emma Holter, for her poem " White Heat " Thanks to all who submitted their poems for consideration!                 Back to Top                                         Contact Us | © New York University , Arts and Science
